okay, here's a sample procedure for moving png files that are 1280x800 in size:
create the target folder with 'mkdir 1280x800', then run    file *.png | grep "1280 x 800" | cut -f : -d 1 | xargs -i cp '{}' 1280x800/
no, you should cd to the source folder first
if you don't, the command will have to be adapted
for the jpeg files, you need to 'sudo apt-get install jpeginfo' and modify the command somewhat
jpeginfo | grep "1280 x 800" | cut -f " " -d 1 | xargs -i cp '{}' 1280x800/
jpeginfo *.png | grep "1280 x 800" | cut -f " " -d 1 | xargs -i cp '{}' 1280x800/
note, this will create copies rather than moving the files. If the copying works, you can try moving instead -- it will be faster.
